text: Justyna Agnieszka Olko (born June 18, 1976) Polish historian and ethnologist, professor of humanities, academic teacher at the University of Warsaw, director of the Center for Engaged Research on Cultural Continuity at the Faculty of "Artes Liberales". == Works == * Insignia of Rank in the Nahua World, University Press of Colorado, 2014 * Meksyk przed konkwistą, Państwowy Instytut Wydawniczy, Warsaw, 2010 * W krainie czerni i czerwieni. Kultury przedhiszpańskiej Mezoameryki (z Jarosławem Źrałką), University of Warsaw Publishing House, Warsaw, 2008 * Turquoise Diadems and Staffs of Office. Insignia of Power in Aztec and Early Colonial Mexico, University of Warsaw, 2005 ==References== ==Other websites== * Olko's website University of Warsaw Category:Living people Category:1976 births Category:Births in Poland Category:People from Warsaw Category:Polish historians Category:Nahuatl language
title: Justyna Olko
